metadata.title: CVE-2024-42242 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:mmc: sdhci: Fix max_seg_size for 64KiB PAGE_SIZEblk_queue_max_segment_size() ensured:	if (max_size < PAGE_SIZE)		max_size = PAGE_SIZE;whereas:blk_validate_limits() makes it an error:	if (WARN_ON_ONCE(lim->max_segment_size < PAGE_SIZE))		return -EINVAL;The change from one to the other, exposed sdhci which was setting maximumsegment size too low in some circumstances.Fix the maximum segment size when it is too low.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-42242` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
